DataElement.preferredName: Investigator Study Site Research Personnel Role Telecommunication Address ISO21090.BAG.TEL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A researcher at a study site who oversees multiple aspects of the study at a site, including protocol submission for IRB approval, participant recruitment, informed consent, data collection, and analysis. A sequence of digits or characters used to identify a particular telephone, fax, or email of a study site personnel.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigator Study Site Research Personnel Role Telecommunication Address
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.:People engaged in research.:The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event._The value for a particular telecommunication address used as the contact telecommunication information for a person or organization.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.:People engaged in research.:The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.
A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.
The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.

Property.preferredDefinition: The value for a particular telecommunication address used as the contact telecommunication information for a person or organization.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An unordered collection of TEL values, where each value can be contained more than once in the condition.
